summary: Completed comprehensive testing of CineGraph movie recommendation platform. Backend APIs properly handle missing TMDB API key with appropriate 401 errors. Frontend loads correctly with cinematic design but lacks user-friendly error messages for API failures.

minor_issues.issue: Returns 200 with empty data instead of 401 error when TMDB API key is invalid
minor_issues.impact: Inconsistent error handling compared to other endpoints

ui_bugs.issue: No user-friendly error message when trending movies fail to load
No user feedback when search fails due to API error

integration_issues.issue: Search dropdown doesn't appear when API returns 401, no error message shown to user
Trending section shows heading but no content or error message when API fails

passed_tests: Homepage loads with CineGraph branding and hero search
Error page displays correctly for recommendations with helpful message
Backend API endpoints return proper 401 errors for invalid TMDB key
Input validation works (empty search query returns 422)

success_percentage.backend: 88% (7/8 tests passed - streaming endpoint behavior differs)
success_percentage.frontend: 60% (UI loads correctly but core functionality fails gracefully without user feedback)

action_item_for_main_agent: Add user-friendly error messages in frontend components when API calls fail. The trending section and search functionality should show helpful messages like 'Please configure TMDB API key' instead of silently failing. The error handling exists for the recommendations page but is missing for homepage components.
